intro: Willdenowia fraterna, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves close to the ground. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are adapted for pollination by insects. Willdenowia fraterna is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
